definition: to clear off/to make a clean sweep of
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: Did he wolf down that peanut butter cookie like the cookie monster was coming?
sentences.chinese: 他有没有像饼干怪兽一样把花生酱曲奇一扫而光？

sentences.english: All the bubbles would have burst away.
sentences.chinese: 所有的泡沫将一扫而光。

sentences.english: He looked at the fence, and all joy left him. A deep sadness settled upon his heart.
sentences.chinese: 一见到围墙，所有的欢乐便一扫而光，悲从中来。

sentences.english: The cream buns and sausage rolls were polished off in next to no time.
sentences.chinese: 转眼之间，奶油面包和腊肠卷就被一扫而光。

sentences.english: Having known the truth, Mei felt free from anger totally.
sentences.chinese: 了解了真相，梅婧心中的怨气一扫而光。

sentences.english: Thus the first hour of misgiving was swept away.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，嘉莉最初的疑虑被一扫而光。

definition: to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to drive away/to force out/to repel
to go up in smoke/to vanish
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
